Autonomous Animals Chicken coop (farm) Pigsty (farm) Cowshed (farm) Sheep pasture Horse Stable (Box1) Horse Stable (Box2) Horse Stable (Box3) Horse Stable (Box4) Horse Stable (Box5) Horse Stable (Box6) Horse Stable (Box7) Horse Stable (Box8) Horse paddock Cow pasture A Calf Igloo A Calf Igloo B Calf Igloo C Calf Igloo D Calf Igloo E Calf Igloo F Calf Igloo G Calf Igloo H Poultry House A Poultry House B Poultry House C Processing Building
Duck Ducklings Ducklings don't lay eggs yet. These are suitable for rearing or can be sold. Duck Ducks provide you with eggs that you can sell at a point of sale or process further in your productions.
Chicken Chick Small chicken chicks can grow into adult chickens. These can then be sold or used to lay eggs. Chicken An adult chicken can be sold or used to produce eggs. A rooster is the boss in the chicken pen and takes care of your chickens.
Goose White Goose Pomoranska Gooses little goose Biela little goose Pomoranska Goose little don't lay eggs yet. These are suitable for rearing or can be sold. Goose White Goose Pomoranska Goose provide you with eggs that you can sell at a point of sale or process further in your productions.
Mangalica Mangalica piglet Mangalica Mangalica big Mangalice known for their easy breeding, they need to be fed to grow big sows.
Pig (Piglet) In order to breed piglets (0-3 months) into fattening pigs, they must be regularly supplied with fresh feed, water and straw. Piglet
Pig (Porker) Porker, also known as fattening pigs, need to be fed well so that they can develop into sows ready for slaughter.
Pig (Sow) These pigs are already fully grown and can be used for reproduction. Sows have a gestation period of 4 months.
Turkeys Turkeys Turkeys small Turkeys Guinea pigs are not yet laying eggs, they are suitable for breeding or can be sold. Turkeys give you eggs that you can use to 1. Breed turkeys. 2. Sell at the point of sale. 3. Process in your productions. Turkeys small Turkeys Guinea pigs are not yet laying eggs, they are suitable for breeding or can be sold. The turkey is bigger than the turkey and will ensure that the turkey lays eggs. But you can also breed them and sell them fattened.
Pheasant pheasant small Pheasant Pheasants are not yet laying eggs, are suitable for breeding or can be sold. Pheasants give you eggs that you can use to 1. Breed pheasants. 2. Sell at the point of sale. 3. Process in your productions.
Peacock Peacock Young male peacock Male peacock The young are not yet laying eggs, are suitable for breeding or can be sold. The peacock forms a pair with the peacock. Together, they provide you with eggs that you can use for 1. Breeding. 2. Sell at the point of sale. 3. Process in your productions. Peacock female young Peacock female The young are not yet laying eggs, are suitable for breeding or can be sold. The peafowl forms a pair with the peacock. Together, they provide you with eggs that you can use for 1. Breeding. 2. Sell at the point of sale. 3. Process in your productions.
Calf (Holstein) Feed your calves regularly so that they can develop into heifers and then into cows. Heifer (Holstein) Feed your heifers regularly so that they can develop into cows. Cow (Holstein) At this stage, cows can have young and give milk.
Calf (Angus) Feed your calves regularly so that they can develop into heifers and then into cows. Heifer (Angus) Feed your heifers regularly so that they can develop into cows. Cow (Angus) At this stage, cows can have young and give milk.
Bull Bull (Holstein) Bull (Angus) Bulls like grass, hay, silage and TMR. Bull calf Bulls are the protectors of your cow herd.
Deer Deer Young people need to be taken care of so that they grow up well. Deer For centuries, the forest deer has been a very popular hunting animal. Deer Males grow up to 175-230 cm and their weight varies between 160-240 kg. Deer eat grass and hay. fawn O mladata sa treba starat aby dobré vyrastli. fawn In the wild, forest deer live an average of 10 to 13 years, in captivity they can live more than 20 years. fawn fawn Females are significantly smaller than males, growing to 160-210 cm and weighing between 120-170 kg. Roe deer eat grass and hay.
Lamb Lambs are the young animals of the sheep, feed your lambs regularly so that they can develop into sheep. Sheep Sheep are the mothers of the sheep, which produce wool or can be sold. Ram Ram Rams are the father animals of the sheep, they serve as protectors of the flock. Note: Rams do not reproduce.
Goat Young goat Goats are the young animals of the goats, feed your kids regularly so that they can develop into goats. Goat Goats are the mothers of the goats, these produce goat's milk or can be sold. Goat's milk is ideal for making goat's cheese. Goat male Goat male Goats male are the father animals of the goats, they serve as protectors of the herd. Note: goats male do not reproduce. Goats eat grass and hay.
Foal (Gray) Mare (Gray) Foal (Palomino) Mare (Palomino) Foal (Black) Mare (Rappe) Foal (Brown) Mare (Brown) Foals need a lot of love and care in order for them to develop into adult animals.
Cat Kitten (Mixed) Cats need fresh food every day. The water supply happens automatically. Kittens can be raised to be big cats. They reach sexual maturity at 8 months. Cats can have small kittens, the gestation period is 2 months. Cat (mackerel) Cat (black/white) Cat (black) Cat (grey) Cat (red) Cat (white)
Rabbit Rabbit (puppy) Rabbit (cub) Rabbit (female) Rabbit (male) Rabbit puppies are the youngest of this species. They cannot be purchased individually and are born from a mother animal. A young rabbit can be used for rearing. Female rabbits also called Zippe, they can have offspring or be sold. The offspring are younger and smaller than a cub. Buck is the male of the rabbit. Can only be bought and sold. Rabbits need straw to be comfortable. Rabbits need a varied diet, among which counts clover, clover hay, carrots lettuce or other vegetables. Fresh water is given automatically. Rabbit Hutch In this habitat you can raise up to 100 rabbits.
Strawberry box Salad box Tomato box Cucumber box Cauliflower box Onion sack Wooden box (fillable) This box can be filled with bulk or earth crops such as potatoes and beets. Pallet fork with attacher. This allows checking for objects such as crates attached to the fork. Apple tree Flour sack Milk palette BigBox Transporting bulk goods. Is recommended in winemaking to get waste products from the productions. Special features: reusable box, this box can be attached to compatible pallet forks. Fillable apple box Can be used to transfer the small apple crates into this larger crate. Special features: Reusable box. Needed to fertilize the beds in the allotment garden.
Rack for IBC tanks A rack used for IBC tanks. Allows liquids to be removed with a bucket. Rack for big bags A frame which is used for BigBags. Enables removal from a BigBag with a wheelbarrow.
Diesel storage tank Bucket (fillable) A bucket can be filled with various things. Water point at the farm Garden pump IBC water tank Watering can (fillable) A watering can is the perfect tool for watering your garden. Operate bale storage!
(company property) Mobile milking parlour This mobile milking parlor is needed to milk your cows on a cow pasture. Mobile milking parlour Operate the milking parlour Compost spreaders are used to increase the yield of fields. Compost spreader

Chicken feed (Bigbag) Fertilizers (Bigbag) Mixed feed (Bigbag) Horse feed (Bigbag) Lime (Bigbag) Pig feed (BigBag) Road salt (Bigbag) Seed (Bigbag)
Fresh wheat can be fed to your chickens. You use big bags to fill up your fertilizer spreaders. The perfect feed mixture for your cattle. Fresh oats can be fed to your horses. You use big bags to fill up your lime spreaders. The perfect feed mixture for your pigs. Road salt can be used to clear snow from the streets as long as it is not too high. You use big bags to fill up your seeders.

Just %d more to go!" tag="format The decorative golden apples have been removed from the two trees on the local park's lake island. Can you find all 50 apples and restore the trees to their former glory? Fender Fertilizer Distribution Unit Fold Pallet spawner Rigid Boundary Spreading System Piano Potato Chips Preserved Food Beetroot Preserved Food Carrots Preserved Food Parsnip Soup Cans Red Beet Soup Carrot Soup Triple Soup Parsnip Soup Potato Soup This special planter is used to plant vegetables. This tool is used to create ridges into which you can plant your vegetables afterwards. This top lifting harvester is used to pull vegetables out of the ground. More Animal Food With the introduction of the new vegetable varieties carrots, parsnips and red beet, you now have more options to feed your animals and to liven up the menu of your pigs and horses.
The new types of feed are included in the feeding plan as follows:
Pigs Base food: either Corn or sorghum Grain: either wheat or barley Protein: either soybeans, canola, or sunflowers Root crops: either potatoes, sugar beet, carrots, parsnips, or red beet
Horses Base food: either oat or sorghum Hay Root crops: either carrots, parsnips, or red beet Creating ridges Before sowing the new crop varieties, it is now possible to create ridges with the Grimme GF 800 ridging equipment. This new step not only makes the vegetable field look more realistic, but also adds a fertiliser stage. The cultivation itself, as with previous root crops, requires specialized seeding and harvesting equipment. With Kverneland's precision planters, the seeds can be planted directly into the ridges. Unlike before, the planting rows can realistically be laid out in straight rows and at 90 angles to each other. Harvesting is done with a tractor in combination with specialized equipment. A self-propelled harvester is also available. For this a higher budget is necessary, but it has the advantage of higher working width. After harvesting, the products can either be sold or processed in one of the factories. Crop Icons The Central European map also has a special selling station to offer: The piano manufacture. When there is no owner, it behaves like a normal selling station. If you are the owner, you can produce prestigious pianos and sell them for a profit. The piano factory needs planks for its production. You can enter the factory and watch the piano being made before your eyes. When it is sold, the piano disappears from the sales room. Production Chains In addition to new building models for already existing productions, new factories will also find their way into Farming Simulator to match the new crops. You can either buy the already placed factories, should you play on Zielonka, or buy and build them yourself via the build mode menu. Product Icons Root Vegetables With the Premium Expansion, new types of root vegetables enter the Farming Simulator. Besides potatoes and sugar beets, it is now possible to grow carrots, parsnip and red beet.
